newsitem.title: BRAZIL: RESEARCH ALERT-Telebras still a buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Telebras still a buy.

text.p: Salomon Brothers said it was maintaining its buy rating on Brazilian telecommunications firm Telebras.
- The report follows Wednesday's announcement of the winning bid for a cellular phone concession in Sao Paulo metropolitan area.
- A group led by U.S. BellSouth Corp. paid 2.6 billion reais, nearly four times the government's asking price, to operate Band B cellular services in the Sao Paulo region.

- Analyst Sari J. Mayer said in a report the result of the auction is extremely positive for Telebras and Telesp , the company's unit serving Sao Paulo state, because the higher-than expected price offered estblishes a benchmark for the valuation of the Band A business.
- also said the rates offered by the winning bidder, slightly below the rates charged by Telesp which currently enjoys a monopoly in the region, reduces the risk of a price war.
- Telebras preferred was up 1.5 percent at 176.81 reais on the Sao Paulo bolsa earlier. Telesp preferred surged 7.07 percent to 394 reais.
